t: When*pn Israel was a child, I loved him, and*ld out of Egypt I called my son.
The*ln more they were called, the*ld more they went away; they*ln kept sacrificing to the Baals and*ld burning offerings to idols.
Yet*pn it was I who taught Ephraim to walk; I*ld took them up by their arms, but*ld they did not know that I healed them.
I*ln led them with cords of kindness, with*ld the bands of love, and*ln I became to them as one who eases the yoke on their jaws, and*ld I bent down to them and fed them.
They*pn shall not return to the land of Egypt, but*ld Assyria shall be their king, because*ld they have refused to return to me.
The*ln sword shall rage against their cities, consume*ld the bars of their gates, and*ld devour them because of their own counsels.
My*ln people are bent on turning away from me, and*ld though they call out to the Most High, he*ld shall not raise them up at all.

How*pn can I give you up, O Ephraim? How*ld can I hand you over, O Israel? How*ln can I make you like Admah? How*ld can I treat you like Zeboiim? My*ln heart recoils within me; my*ld compassion grows warm and tender.
I*ln will not execute my burning anger; I*ld will not again destroy Ephraim; for*ln I am God and not a man, the*ld Holy One in your midst, and*ld I will not come in wrath.
They*pn shall go after the Lord;*s he*ld will roar like a lion; when*ln he roars, his*ld children shall come trembling from the west;
they*ln shall come trembling like birds from Egypt, and*ld like doves from the land of Assyria, and*ld I will return them to their homes, declares the Lord.*s
Ephraim*ln has surrounded me with lies, and*ld the house of Israel with deceit, but*ln Judah still walks with God and*ld is faithful to the Holy One.
